data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to the individual word senses (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text fragments, collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each fragment is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Incorporates entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset of over 10,700 news headlines provides insights into sentiment variations depending on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts from the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), tokenized and annotated. This resource aims to understand the influence of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships within financial documents with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X forms. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, it allows researchers to explore how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial context, which helps identify and classify financial companies in textual data.

Provides a multilingual financial dataset for NLP with real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with in-depth analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning about financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
